definitions.definition: (heading) To maintain or keep to a position or state.
(heading) To maintain or keep to particular opinions, promises, actions.
To win one's own service game.
To organise an event or meeting (usually in passive voice).
definitions.example: Elections will be held on the first Sunday of next month.

definitions.definition: In a food or drink order at an informal restaurant etc., requesting that a component normally included in that order be omitted.
definitions.example: A martini, please, and hold the olive.

definitions.definition: To be in possession of illicit drugs for sale.
Something that one owns, especially stocks and bonds.
A determination of law made by a court.
A tenure; a farm or other estate held of another.
That which holds, binds, or influences.
The burden or chorus of a song.
(in texts about Russia) A holding company, or other kind of company (by back-translation from Russian холдинг).
